Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If there is an active spam attack, GUI wallet users will not be able to easily deal with that, but can fiddle with various fee values to see what works. Better would be GUI wallet looks at last X blocks, and creates a "slow/medium/fast" option for users, to get stuff confirmed

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Each GUI wallet does their own thing, and many might not allow setting a fee, but if attacks really start, they will evolve

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://twitter.com/dukeleto/status/1162394651682320384

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Privatoshi in reality, you are going to find a wallet you want to modify, and "fork that"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and so, there is much less choice

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You use what that thing uses

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Privatoshi if you want to fork SilentDragon (not a bad idea), you need to know C++ and QT

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> QT is a gui library

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> which can be used from any language, but you will be using it from C++, C++14 to be exact

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Privatoshi if you instead wanted to fork Verus Agama, that is Javascript and nodeJS world, like Chinese vs Russian

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So what you fork decides some things for you

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> And yes, you can start from scratch. But damn, who has the time for that?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> And yes, writing from scratch will teach you the most, but it's not for everybody

Author: Gateway#3763
